result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter Joseph Megna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
**12/3/2015  Set at $3,843.69.  to be paid to victim Sheila B.  To be paid first, before costs/fees/surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/earnings. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*1/30/2017  Restitution previously ordered in the amount of $3,843.69 payable to Shelia B remains.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/earnings.

Concurrent with: 1/30/2017  Sentence adjustment.  Concurrent.  Credit for 127 days.
No Contact Order remains with Sheilia B.

superMiscConds.notes:
No driving without a valid license.
No use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Prescription to be turned over to agent BEFORE filling the prescription.
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Granting Defendant's Postconviction Motion.

Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in court with attorney Carly M Cusack.  Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in custody (video conference).  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SENTENCE ADJUSTMENT.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS concurrent, with credit for 127 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS WITH Shelia B.
RESTITUTION PREVIOUSLY ORDERED IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,843.69 PAYABLE TO SHELIA B. REMAINS.
State's response to defendant's postconviction motion.

Signed and filed: Order for briefing schedule. The State's response is due on or before 1/12/17. The defendant's reply is due on or before 1/26/17. Copies generated, and distributed to ADA O'byrne and Atty C. Cusack.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. mag
Exhibit A (for postconviction motion) received in 15CF1444 and 15CF2844. Filed in 15CF1444.
on cases 15CF2844 and 15CF001444
per order dated November 17, 2016 the deadline for Megna to file a post conviction motion or notice of appeal in these matters is extended to 12/5/16. tf
per order dated October 6, 2016, Appeal 2016XX90CR on cases 15CF1444 and 15CF2844, the deadline for Megna to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended throughNovember  14, 2016.
Motion to Extend Time to File a Notice of Appeal or Post Conviction Motion under Rule 809.30(2)(h), Filed
Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, calendar successor, for review. mag

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered this matter adjourned for sentencing but allowed the victim to make a statement today. Statements made by Sheila B. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned to Branch 25. 

Filed;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment;
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Walter Joseph Megna not in court, in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Walter Joseph Megna not in court, in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court granted request for another scheduling conference before Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Walter Joseph Megna not in court, in custody.  
Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution and possible transfer to drug treatment court.  Joint request for adjournment granted.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
TOT to Justice Point:  no drugs or alcohol; no firearms or weapons;  all no contact orders remain in effect.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Walter Joseph Megna not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Ann R. Lopez for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.  Defendant returned on the warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $3,500.00 cash.

Defense counsel requested a scheduling date; defendant has been charged with another case (15CF2844) which is set for preliminary hearing on 6/30/15.  Court granted joint request and ordered case adjourned for scheduilng before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6/18/15.  Bench Warrant filed.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2,500.00 signature bond) ad
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in court with attorney Terese M. Dick. Ann Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court does not object to transfer of case 15CT229 as long as Branch 24 has no objection.  All conditions of bail remain the same.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 20.
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING  transcript commencing APRIL 20, 2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY TERESE DICK, 819 NORTH 6TH STREET, MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN, 53203. kl

Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Kenneth Justus, O-MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Walter Joseph Megna in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense motion to DISMISS DENIED. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
